definition: Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: The boys wore black tail coats in mourning for George III.
sentences.chinese: 男孩身穿黑色燕尾服爲喬治三世服喪。

sentences.english: For a formal occasion at the palace you must wear tails.
sentences.chinese: 在宮廷正式的場合中，你應該穿燕尾服。

sentences.english: You don't have to wear swallowtail for the semiformal opening party.
sentences.chinese: 你不必穿燕尾服參加半正式的開幕酒會。

sentences.english: The Riverside rides on the coattails of that design and even cuts a few corners to get there.
sentences.chinese: 濱江騎上設計的燕尾服，甚至削減幾個小錢到那裏。

sentences.english: As for Justin with his tux and his side-slicked hair?
sentences.chinese: 至於賈斯汀的燕尾服和老式髮型？

sentences.english: Beautiful performances to magic. But you do not have to wear black high-top hat, put on coat.
sentences.chinese: 而且你也不一定要戴上高頂黑色大禮帽，穿上燕尾服。

sentences.english: The invitation specified that the dress code would be formal, so I donned my tuxedo.
sentences.chinese: 請柬規定要着正裝，於是我穿上了燕尾服。

sentences.english: I need to get a custom-made Tuxedo for my wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我要爲婚禮去定作一件燕尾服。

sentences.english: Will we allow our national character to continue to erode on the liberal coattail ?
sentences.chinese: 我們將繼續讓我們的民族性格，對自由燕尾服侵蝕？

sentences.english: You are in an age like spring. Fly high with your wings of ideal!
sentences.chinese: 你正值奏一般的年紀，快燕尾服開理想的彩翼。

sentences.english: One happy fellow wore a bridal skirt and a tuxedo jacket.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個開心的傢伙既穿着婚紗，又穿着燕尾服。

definition: ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
woman's suit/dress worn over a petticoat
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
